Secs. 10-361-10-380. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE XIII. - SIGN CODE[13] 

Footnotes: 
--- (13) --- 
Cross reference- Advertising and signs in parks, § 58-67; signs generally, ch. 78; special development controls for sign regulations, app. A, § 9-5. 

Sec. 10-381. - Adoption. 
    That certain document, one copy of which is on file in the office of the city secretary, being marked and designated as Uniform Sign Code, 1988 edition, published by the International Conference of Building Officials, is hereby adopted as the code of the city for providing minimum standards to safeguard life, health, property and public welfare by regulating and controlling the design, quality of materials, construction, location, electrification and maintenance of all signs and sign structures not located within a building; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, conditions and terms of such Uniform Sign Code, 1988 edition, as published by the International Conference of Building Officials, on file in the office of the city, are hereby referred to, adopted and made a part hereof as if fully set out in this section. 
(Code 1987, § 4-361) 
Secs. 10-382-10-400. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE XIV. - SWIMMING POOLS AND SPA CODE[14] 

Footnotes: 
--- (14) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 2013-14, § 5, adopted August 20, 2013, amended article XIV in its entirety to read as herein set out. Formerly, article XIV, § 10-401, pertained to the code for swimming pools, spas and hot tubs, and derived from the Code of 1987, § 4-371. 
Cross reference- Health regulations for public swimming pools and spas, § 42-61 et seq.; special development controls for swimming pools, app. A, § 9-4. 

Sec. 10-401. - Adoption of swimming pools and spa code. 
    The 2018 Edition of the International Swimming Pool and Spa Code is hereby adopted as the official swimming pool and spa code of the City of Saginaw, Texas, and is fully incorporated by reference as though copied into this section in its entirety. The material contained in such code shall not be included in the formal municipal codification of ordinances but shall be maintained as a public record in the office of the city secretary and will be available for public inspection and copying during regular business hours. 
(Ord. No. 2013-14, § 5, 8-20-13; Ord. No. 2018-21, § 5, 12-4-18) 
Sec. 10-402. - Amendments to International Code for Swimming Pools and Spas. 
    The City of Saginaw may from time to time determine that local modifications to the swimming pools and spa code are necessary and appropriate to meet the unique needs of the City of Saginaw. To effectuate modifications, the city council may enact individual ordinances amending the swimming pools and spa code, and such amendments shall be consolidated as an exhibit to the swimming pools and spa code, and shall be maintained as a public record in the office of the city secretary. 
(Ord. No. 2013-14, § 5, 8-20-13; Ord. No. 2018-21, § 5, 12-4-18) 
Secs. 10-403-10-430. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE XV. - LANDSCAPING AND SCREENING[15] 

Footnotes: 
--- (15) --- 
Cross reference- Environment, ch. 30. 

Sec. 10-431. - Intent and purpose. 
(a)  Regulation of the installation and maintenance of landscaped areas and screening requirements is necessary to encourage the general attractiveness of the city, promote the value of property and to enhance the environment thereof for the general welfare of its citizens. It is the intention of this article to establish certain regulations which will: 
(1)  Promote and enhance the public health, safety, comfort, morals and convenience; 
(2)  Enhance the economy and the business and industry of the city by providing reasonable and effective landscaped and screening areas; 
(3)  Provide restrictions which would decrease the possibility and probability of traffic congestion and accidents by obstructing visibility to traffic; and 
(4)  Provide landscaped areas to allow the absorption of rainfall and runoff waters. 
(b)  In the interpretation and application of this article the requirements herein shall be held to be the minimum requirements necessary for the promotion and protection of the general public's health, safety, comfort, morals and convenience and shall apply to all requests for building permits and certificates of occupancy in areas other than single-family, two-family duplex and industrially zoned areas. 
(Code 1987, § 4-376) 
Sec. 10-432. - General. 
(a)  Jurisdiction. The provisions of this article shall apply to all parking lots, service and drive areas accommodating two or more vehicles and for all open storage areas. 
(b)  Landscaping. Landscaping shall consist of a combination of such vegetation as grasses and ground covers and may consist of a combination of scrubs, hedges or trees. 
(c)  Screening wall. A screening wall shall be of solid wood fencing, brick or masonry construction at a minimum height of six feet except as otherwise noted in this article or required by other ordinances or decisions by the city. 
(d)  Area requirement. The area to be landscaped shall be in addition to the area contained in the street right-of-way. On lots where the required parking is not adjacent to a dedicated street, the landscaping requirement shall apply to the area between the buildings or structures and the street. Landscaping of right-of-way is encouraged, but must be approved by the director of public works. 
(e)  Interior landscaping. Interior planting islands shall be provided at a minimum of one for every 12 parking spaces or fraction thereof. Interior planting islands shall have a minimum size equal to the dimensions of one parking space on applicable parking lot. All landscaped areas shall be protected from vehicular encroachment of overhang through appropriate wheel stops or curbs. 
(f)  Screening wall use. When a tract of land is located adjacent to an area used or zoned for single-family or two-family duplex purposes, a visual screen shall be installed and maintained along the entire length of the common lot line. The screen shall consist of a solid fence of a minimum height of six feet. These standards shall also apply when a multifamily use is established adjacent to property used or zoned for single-family or two-family duplex purposes. 
(g)  Open-storage areas. Open areas used for the purpose of storing machinery, merchandise, equipment or any other items associated with a business conducted on or off-site shall be placed at the rear of the property and shall provide a visual screen for areas adjacent to a street right-of-way. Such screen shall be a solid wood fence or brick or masonry wall a minimum of eight feet in height. No fence or wall shall be constructed closer than 15 feet back of the curb or property line, whichever is greater. A maximum of 25 percent of the total lot may be used for open-air display of merchandise or rental equipment for sale or lease or rental and shall not require a screening wall between the display area and street right-of-way. When an open-storage area is adjacent to a residential use or district, a screening wall shall be installed between the storage area and the residential use or district a minimum of eight feet in height. 
(h)  Trash enclosure. A visual screen consisting of a solid fence having a minimum height of eight feet shall be installed so as to screen trash containers from the street right-of-way and/or residential uses or districts. Said trash enclosure shall be screened on a minimum of three sides with the open side oriented so as not to be viewed from a street or residential use or district or equipped with screening-type gates. 
(Code 1987, § 4-377) 
Sec. 10-433. - Required vegetation in landscaped areas. 
(a)  Grass. Grass shall be a species normally grown as permanent lawns in the local area. Grass may be sodded, plugged, sprigged or seeded, except that solid sod shall be used in swales or other areas subject to erosion. Ground cover may be used in lieu of grass and shall be planted in such a manner as to present a finished appearance and reasonably complete coverage within six months after planting. 
(b)  Visibility and clearance. No landscaping, tree, fence, wall or other similar item shall be maintained within a visibility triangle of a corner, street, intersection or approach intersecting a public right-of-way which creates an obstruction to visibility between three feet and eight feet above the adjacent pavement, extends into sight lines or is determined to be a traffic hazard. 
(Code 1987, § 4-378) 
Sec. 10-434. - Screening and landscape plan required. 
(a)  Prior to the issuance of a building permit or certificate of occupancy for all new construction or enlargements of 50 percent of the existing floor area or required parking area by 12 or more parking spaces, it shall be necessary to submit a screening and landscaping plan for approval to the building official. Such plan shall show all planting and screening areas drawn to scale. Any landscaping plan not meeting or exceeding the minimum requirements of this article shall be submitted for approval to the planning and zoning commission for approval prior to a building permit or certificate of occupancy being issued. Any appeal of the planning and zoning commission decision shall be subject to review by the city council. 
(b)  All screening and landscaping must be in place as indicated on the approved screening and landscaping plan prior to the issuance of the certificate of occupancy. If seasonal considerations prohibit the immediate installation of the required landscaping, the certificate of occupancy may be issued if the following conditions are met: 
(1)  The project conforms to all other applicable codes and ordinances relating to the request; and 
(2)  All landscaping shall be installed per the approved screening and landscaping plan within six months after the issuance of such conditional certificate of occupancy. If the landscaping has not been installed at the end of the six-month period, the penalty provisions of this article will be enforced. 
(Code 1987, § 4-379) 
Sec. 10-435. - Maintenance. 
    It shall be the joint and several liability of the owner/developer, tenant or agent in control to keep all required landscaping or screening maintained in a neat and orderly manner at all times. This shall include mowing, pruning, fertilizing, watering, weeding and any other such activities common to the maintenance of landscaping. Yard sprinkler systems will be required if properly installed yard hydrants are not located within 50 feet of any landscaped area. All plant material shall be maintained in a healthy and growing condition as is appropriate for the season of the year. All dead plant material shall be replaced with new plant material within the next growing season. All screening walls shall be kept in good repair so as to maintain a continuous visual screen. 
(Code 1987, § 4-380) 
Sec. 10-436. - Penalty. 
    Violation of any provision of this article shall be deemed a misdemeanor, and upon conviction thereof any person, firm or corporation violating the same shall be fined in any sum not to exceed $500.00. 
(Code 1987, § 4-381) 
Secs. 10-437-10-460. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE XVI. - CONTRACTORS[16] 

Footnotes: 
--- (16) --- 
Cross reference- Businesses, ch. 14. 

Sec. 10-461. - Definitions. 
    For the purpose of this article, the following definitions shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them in this section: 
    Board of appeals means a board appointed by the city council vested with the right to hear appeals from any person, firm, or corporation aggrieved by the decision, ruling, interpretation of order of the building official, hereinafter referred to as the board. 
    Building contractor means any person, firm, or corporation engaged by remuneration in the erection or construction of new buildings or structures, either residential or nonresidential. 
    Building official means the person duly designated to act in such capacity for the city. 
    Business means any venture by a person, firm, or corporation for the express purpose of making a profit from the sale or exchange of goods or services. 
    Codes (the codes) means the codes herein referred to as the following and adopted and approved by the city: 
Ordinance No. 88-17-Uniform Administrative Code. 
Ordinance No. 88-21-National Electrical Code. 
Ordinance No. 88-22-National Electrical Code amendments. 
Ordinance No. 88-23-Uniform Housing Code. 
Ordinance No. 88-24-Uniform Mechanical Code. 
Ordinance No. 88-25-Uniform Plumbing Code. 
Ordinance No. 88-26-Plumbing code amendments. 
Ordinance No. 88-28-Uniform Swimming Pool, Spa and Hot Tub Code. 
Ordinance No. 88-30-Uniform Fire Code and Uniform Fire Code Standards. 
Ordinance No. 97-2-Uniform Plumbing Code. 
Ordinance No. 98-3-Uniform Building Code and recommended amendments by North Central Texas Council of Governments, Uniform Building Security Code, Uniform Housing Code, Uniform Sign Code and Uniform Code for the Abatement of Dangerous Buildings. 
Ordinance No. 98-4-Uniform Mechanical Code. 
    Electrical contractor means any person, firm, or corporation engaged in the installation or altering, by remuneration, of electrical conductors or equipment, who is duly licensed as a master electrician as accepted by reciprocity by the city, having been tested by an examining agency or board. 
    Examining agency or board , means, for the purpose of the codes, any division of the state, the county or the city, whose sole function is to test, regulate, or certify the ability of an individual for the performance of work as defined specifically elsewhere in this section. 
    Fire protection systems contractor means any person, firm, or corporation engaged in the installation or altering, by remuneration, of fire suppression and detection systems, who is duly licensed by the state to perform such work. 
    Homeowner means any bona fide homeowner, by himself, for himself, on his own homestead premises and without compensation, and no person shall be employed to assist him in any way on such work as may be allowed by the codes. Such person must file in writing a notarized statement of such and be able to file with the building official as to his ability to perform such work, apply for and secure necessary permits, pay required fees, do work in accordance with the codes, apply for all necessary inspections, and receive the necessary approvals in all such work done. 
    License means the necessary documentation by an examining agency or board to verify, clarify, and attest as to having met the necessary qualifications for such. 
    Mechanical contractor means any person, firm, or corporation engaged by remuneration in the installation or altering of any type of heating, air conditioning, ventilation, refrigeration equipment, or other mechanical systems such as incinerators, or other miscellaneous heat producing appliances, who is duly licensed as a mechanical contractor (A or B) by the state (A or B classification limits the type of work performed by the licensee). 
    Paving contractor means any person, firm, or corporation engaged by remuneration in the installation or repair of horizontal surface driveways, alleys, or approaches either of concrete, asphalt, or any other common substance used in surfacing traffic or pedestrian ways. 
    Plumbing contractor means any person, firm, or corporation engaged by remuneration in the installation or altering of any piping systems used to convey water, sewer, gas, or waste products ventilated by them, who is duly licensed as a master plumber by the state. 
    Reciprocity means the acknowledging of other examining agencies or boards to regulate or certify the ability of an individual for the performance of work defined specifically elsewhere in this section, at the approval of the building official. 
    Registration means the registering of any person, firm, or corporation with the city to perform such work as covered and required by the codes. In extending the rights and privilege of such registration, the city makes no statement of the technical competency of those so registered, and no manner of license is proffered. 
    Remodeling means any person, firm, or corporation engaged by remuneration in the alteration or enlargement of any existing building or structure, to include roofing and siding work, either residential or nonresidential, who is or employs properly licensed personnel for the performance of the necessary work. 
    Sign contractor means any person, firm, or corporation engaged by remuneration in the erection, construction, or altering of advertising faces, whether painted, wood, masonry, metal, glass, or plastic, with or without illumination, permanent or temporary in use, whether attached to a building, pole or any other structure, who is or employs individuals properly licensed and registered for all electrical work in conjunction to or accessory to any and all work performed. 
    Sprinkler system contractor means any person, firm, or corporation engaged by remuneration in the installation, repair or alteration of underground piping systems of either potable or nonpotable water, aboveground irrigation watering or other such similar installations deriving their water from the city, either directly or indirectly, who is duly licensed by a recognized examining agency or board. 
    Swimming pool contractor means any person, firm, or corporation engaged by remuneration in the installation, repair, or alteration of inground or aboveground devices or appurtenances getting recreational pleasure to private or public parties obtaining their water from the city, either directly or indirectly. 
    Utility contractor means any person, firm, or corporation engaged by remuneration in the installation of transmission or collection systems of potable water, nonpotable water, sewage, stormwater runoff drainage, gas, electrical, video, audio, and other such systems, who is or employs individuals properly licensed and registered for the performance of all necessary work, and is not directly employed by payroll or by subcontract of any utility company, public or private, in the normal conduct of business. 
(Code 1987, § 12-121) 
Cross reference- Definitions generally, § 1-2. 
Sec. 10-462. - Permits issued to registrants only. 
    A permit to perform or cause to be performed any work regulated by the codes shall only be issued to a registrant as provided for in this article, and only after the requirements defined in this article have been performed. For all work requiring licensing under this article, no permit shall be issued unless registrant designates the contractor, as herein defined, who will be responsible to the building official for the prosecution and supervision of the work to be performed. Only such designated contractor may request inspection prior to the issuance of a permit. The building official may review the proposed project with other departments of the city to ensure that no conflict with other city regulations is created or perpetuated by issuance of a permit. An adverse determination in this review may be grounds for denial of a permit. The provisions of this article shall not apply to air-conditioning and refrigeration contractors who hold a license under Vernon's Ann. Civ. St. art. 8861. 
(Code 1987, § 12-122) 
Sec. 10-463. - Exemption. 
    No registration contractor requirements shall exist for alteration or repair work to be performed on a residential structure when the person performing the alteration or repair work is the owner of the structure as defined in this article. The homeowner shall automatically be termed registrant for the purposes of such a project. Notwithstanding such relief from registration, all requirements for permits for work shall remain in force. 
(Code 1987, § 12-123) 
Sec. 10-464. - Age requirement. 
    No person under 18 years of age shall be registered as a contractor. 
(Code 1987, § 12-124) 
Sec. 10-465. - Registration-Application. 
    An applicant for registration under this article shall provide to the building official the following information: 
(1)  The complete name, complete mailing address and telephone number of the person, firm, or corporation. 
(2)  The complete name, private mailing address, social security number and state driver's license number of a principal of the firm or corporation, who is a person authorized to bind the firm or corporation in legal agreements. 
(3)  The name and license identification of the contractor, where required by definition in this article, through whom the person, firm, or corporation is to be represented in all activities before the building official (except registration for a person, firm, or corporation specifically exempted from license requirements). 
(4)  A copy of commercial legal liability insurance in an amount not less than $100,000.00 combined for property damage and bodily injury sustained by one or more persons, and $100,000.00 aggregate, and $100,000.00 aggregate for products and completed operations. In the event claims occur which hold the required coverage to a level of $75,000.00 or less, the registered contractor shall reinstate the coverage to the original $100,000.00 amount or greater. 
a.  A registered contractor shall furnish to the city a certificate of insurance as evidence of the insurance requirement of subsection (4) of this section. 
1.  Insurance must be valid for the next 60 days. 
2.  Insurance certificate must list registrant's name and company name and address. 
3.  Certificate holder must be listed as: 
City of Saginaw 
Building Inspection Department 
P.O. Drawer 79070 
Saginaw, Texas 76179 
ATTN: Building Official 
b.  The certificate of insurance shall certify that the policy has been endorsed with the provision that in the event such coverage is cancelled or reduced, the insurance carrier shall notify the department at least 45 days prior to such cancellation or reduction of coverage. Each nonrenewal notice shall also be submitted by the insurance carrier to the department at least 45 days prior to the renewal date. In the event that the coverage is cancelled for nonpayment of premium, the insurance carrier shall notify the department at least ten days prior to such cancellation. 
c.  The certificate of insurance will be accepted only when signed by those officers or agents of an insurance company empowered to sign such certificates by the insurance company. 
d.  Each registrant shall be suspended during any period in which the required insurance is not in effect by evidence of a current certificate of insurance on file with the city building inspection department or when the required level of insurance has not been reinstated as required in subsection (4) of this section. 
e.  The building official may waive the insurance requirement for a registrant who is not contracting with the general public. All requests to waive the insurance requirements shall be submitted in writing to the building official and shall contain a detailed explanation of the conditions on which the registrant is requesting a waiver. 
(5)  Other pertinent information deemed necessary to the building official such as: Every registrant shall make contact with the office of the building inspection department to ensure the accurate revision of the registration information, including change of a licensed individual or address or telephone number, within ten working days from when the previous information supplied in the application is made invalid for any reason. 
(Code 1987, § 12-125; Ord. No. 91-7, § 2, 8-6-91) 
Sec. 10-466. - Same-Fees. 
(a)  For registration as required by this article, a fee shall be paid in addition to the other provisions provided. The fee will be as specified by subsections (b) and (c) of this section, which set forth the fee structure as approved by the city council and which may be amended from time to time by resolution by the city council. 
(b)  Registration fees shall be due prior to performing any work requiring a permit. All registration fees shall be due one year from the date of registration. Registration fees shall be in the amount of $25.00 per year. 
(c)  No registration fee paid hereunder shall be refundable or subject to proration. 
(Code 1987, § 12-126; Ord. No. 91-7, § 2, 8-6-91) 
Sec. 10-467. - Same-Expiration; renewal. 
    Registration shall expire annually or, at the option of the registrant, after two years by payment of the optional fee, and shall be routinely reactivated by payment of a renewal fee if application information remains accurate. A registration may be renewed as herein provided at any time from 60 days preceding the date of expiration through 60 days following the date of expiration. Registration not renewed for 60 days beyond the date of expiration shall require resubmittal of registration information and payment of fee as for initial registration. 
(Code 1987, § 12-127) 
Sec. 10-468. - Currently registered contractors. 
    A currently registered contractor shall be required to provide the necessary certificate of insurance as required in section 10-465 by the renewal date of their current registration. 
(Code 1987, § 12-128; Ord. No. 91-7, § 2, 8-6-91) 
Sec. 10-469. - Transfer of registration-Generally. 
    No registrant under this article shall allow his registration, by name or other identification, to be transferred or assigned to or in any manner directly or indirectly used by any person, firm, or corporation other than the one to whom issued by the building official, for any purpose. 
(Code 1987, § 12-129) 
Sec. 10-470. - Same-Violations; penalty. 
(a)  No registration issued or renewed under the terms of this article shall ever be transferred to or used by any person other than the one to whom it has been issued. 
(b)  It shall be unlawful for the holder of a registration of any type to allow his name or registration to be used by any other person, firm, or corporation, directly or indirectly, for the purpose of obtaining a permit or for performing work under his registration. 
(c)  Notwithstanding the provisions of section 10-471 of this article, upon final conviction of any violation of subsections (a) and (b) of this section, the registration of such persons shall be automatically suspended for a period of six months. 
(Code 1987, § 12-130) 
Sec. 10-471. - Suspension, revocation of registration. 
(a)  Causes for suspension. The board of appeals shall have the authority to suspend any registration issued under this article for any of the following acts by the registrant or persons under supervision by the registrants: 
(1)  Forfeiting an appeal of a stop work order by the building official or his designates by continued work, whether of the registrant, or of the one under his supervision, after the issuance of the stop work order. 
(2)  Forfeiting an appeal from the board by initiating work in violation of the board's decision or prior to the board's decision. 
(3)  Causing or permitting the authorized or prohibited use of a valid registration, by registrant or another, such as to allow the rights and privileges of registration to be applied to one not duly registered. 
(4)  Conviction of one violation of any of the provisions of the codes committed within a period of 12 consecutive months, except that remedy of the violation within 20 days of notice of violation shall cause the waiver of such convictions for the purpose of this subsection. 
(b)  Causes for revocation. The board shall have the authority to revoke any registration issued under this article for any of the following acts by the registrants: 
(1)  Conviction of a violation constituting the practice of any fraud or deceit in securing: 
a.  A registration for another; or 
b.  A permit. 
(2)  Convictions of three violations of any of the provisions of the codes committed within a period of 12 consecutive months. 
(3)  Accumulation of two decisions of the board for suspensions of license. 
(4)  Accumulation of two forfeitures of appeals, as set forth in subsections (a)(1) or (2) of this section, within 12 consecutive months. 
Such revocation of registration by the board shall be full and final, subject only to appeal to a court of competent jurisdiction. Cancellation shall be effective on the date of the board's decision. Any registrant so cancelled by the board shall not again be eligible for registration for a period of two years. 
(c)  Hearing; appeal. In considering charges under this article regarding suspension or revocation of registration, the board shall proceed upon information furnished it by an official of the city or by any other person by a written complaint. Such information shall be in writing and shall be duly verified by the person familiar with the allegations made. The board shall make an order setting the matter for hearing at a specified time and place, and the secretary of the board, with the advice of the city attorney, shall cause a copy of the board's order, and of the pertinent information, to be served upon the registrant in person or by certified mail at least 15 days before the date set for the hearing. The registrant may appear in person or by counsel at the time and place named in the order, and present his defense to the board. The city attorney shall provide counsel for the board. If the registrant fails or refuses to appear, the board may proceed to hear and determine the charge in his absence. If he pleads guilty or, if upon a hearing of the charge, the board finds any of the charges to be true, the board may enter an order suspending or revoking the registration. Failure to properly perfect an appeal to a court of competent jurisdiction within ten days receipt of written notice of the board's decision shall be deemed a waiver of any rights of appeal. Suspension or revocation resulting from a decision of the board shall preclude the registrant from securing a permit for work controlled by that registrant in the city or from becoming so registered under alternate identification, as long as the suspension or revocation is in effect. 
(Code 1987, § 12-131) 
Sec. 10-472. - Responsibilities of registrants. 
(a)  Operations. Where required, the licensed contractors shall be responsible for the performance of permitted work in compliance with the codes. 
(b)  Administration. Registrants shall be responsible for the employment of properly licensed personnel where required to perform the permitted work, and for the payment of fees as required by the codes. 
(c)  Display of registration. The holder of a registration issued under this article shall carry his registration on or about his person at all times while performing work and shall present such registration immediately upon request to the building official or his designated representative. 
(d)  Furnishing address, telephone number. The holder of a registration of any type shall furnish the building official written notice of his permanent address. The holder of any contractor registration shall furnish, in addition, a written notice of the address and telephone number of his regularly established business. 
(e)  Marking of vehicles. A street vehicle operated by a contractor registrant or employee of a contractor registrant and used in the business of performing work under this article shall bear markings clearly expressing, in letters not less than four inches in height, the name of the firm or corporation for which work is being performed by the registrant. Magnetic signage or easily removable signage is expressly prohibited. 
(Code 1987, § 12-132) 
Sec. 10-473. - Employment of unlicensed workers. 
    It shall be unlawful for a contractor to employ by remuneration any unlicensed person to do or to perform any work governed by the codes for which a proper license is required. 
(Code 1987, § 12-133) 
Secs. 10-474-10-500. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE XVII. - AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEMS 

Sec. 10-501. - License required. 
    It shall be unlawful to install, construct, maintain service, repair, alter, or modify environmental air conditioning systems within the city except as follows: 
(1)  Class A state license required by the installer or repairman if any single cooling source until develops more than 300,000 Btu's per hour (25 tons) of cooling capacity or if any single heating unit develops more than 1.5 million Btu's per hour heating capacity, in the system being installed or maintained; 
(2)  Class B state license required by the installer or repairman if any single cooling source unit develops less than 300,000 Btu's per hour (25 tons) or if any single heating source produces less than 1.5 million Btu's per hour heating capacity, in the system being installed or maintained; or 
(3)  A combination of smaller units totaling more than 25 tons of cooling or more than 1.5 million Btu's of heating shall not require a class A license, but will require a class B license, by the installer or repairman. 
(Code 1987, § 12-11) 
Sec. 10-502. - Permit required. 
    Before a person shall contract for the installation, construction, alteration, repair, or modification of any environmental air conditioning system within the city, they shall first obtain a permit. 
(Code 1987, § 12-12) 
Sec. 10-503. - Permit fee. 
    Each person applying for an air conditioning permit shall obtain a registration permit from the city at a cost of $100.00 and renewable on January 1 of each year at a cost of $50.00. Any request for renewal after February 1 shall be processed as a first time request and charged accordingly. 
(Code 1987, § 12-13) 
Sec. 10-504. - Display of license number. 
    Each contractor shall display the license number and class of license in letters not less than two inches high on both sides of all vehicles along with the company name. 
(Code 1987, § 12-14) 
Sec. 10-505. - Insurance. 
(a)  Each class A license holder shall furnish the city with proof of liability insurance in the amount of $300,000.00 bodily injury, property damage in the amount of $300,000.00 and $300,000.00 aggregate. 
(b)  Each class B license holder shall furnish the city with proof of liability insurance in the amount of $100,000.00 for bodily injury, property damage in the amount of $100,000.00 and $100,000.00 aggregate. 
(Code 1987, § 12-15) 
Sec. 10-506. - Exemptions. 
    The exemptions from license requirement are as follows: 
(1)  Any person who performs air conditioning work in a building owned solely by him and which is his residence; 
(2)  Any person who performs maintenance work if the person is regularly employed as a maintenance person or licensed as a maintenance engineer, if the work is performed in connection with the business in which the person is employed and the person does not engage in the occupation of air conditioning contracting for the general public; 
(3)  Any person who performs air conditioning contracting and is employed by a regulated utility. Such work must be performed in connection with the utility business in which the person is employed; 
(4)  Any person who performs plumbing work and is licensed under the plumbing license state law; or 
(5)  Any person who assists in the performance of air conditioning work under the direct supervision of a license holder. 
(Code 1987, § 12-16) 
Secs. 10-507-10-525. - Reserved.

ARTICLE XX. - INTERNATIONAL FUEL GAS CODE[19] 

Footnotes: 
--- (19) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 2013-14, § 8, adopted August 20, 2013, amended article XX in its entirety to read as herein set out. Formerly, article XX pertained to similar subject matter, and derived from Ord. No. 2005-08, §§ 10, 11, adopted May 17, 2005, and Ord. No. 2009-01, §§ 10, 11, adopted January 20, 2009. 

Sec. 10-561. - Adoption of fuel gas code. 
    The 2018 Edition of the International Fuel Gas Code is hereby adopted as the official fuel gas code of the City of Saginaw, Texas, and is fully incorporated by reference as though copied into this section in its entirety. The material contained in such code shall not be included in the formal municipal codification of ordinances but shall be maintained as a public record in the office of the city secretary and will be available for public inspection and copying during regular business hours. 
(Ord. No. 2013-14, § 8, 8-20-13; Ord. No. 2018-21, § 8, 12-4-18) 
Sec. 10-562. - Amendments to International Fuel Gas Code. 
    The City of Saginaw may from time to time determine that local modifications to the fuel gas code are necessary and appropriate to meet the unique needs of the City of Saginaw. To effectuate modifications, the city council may enact individual ordinances amending the fuel gas code, and such amendments shall be consolidated as an exhibit to the fuel gas code, and shall be maintained as a public record in the office of the city secretary. 
(Ord. No. 2013-14, § 8, 8-20-13; Ord. No. 2018-21, § 8, 12-4-18) 
Secs. 10-563-10-574. - Reserved.

ARTICLE XXIV. - RENTAL REGISTRATION AND INSPECTION PROGRAM[22] 

Footnotes: 
--- (22) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, adopted Sept. 18, 2018, enacted provisions designated as §§ 10-597-10-613; however, to conform to the style of this code, said provisions have been redesignated as §§ 10-611-10-627 at the discretion of the editor. 

Sec. 10-611. - Purpose. 
    The purpose of this article is to safeguard the life, health, safety, welfare and property of the occupants of rental dwelling units and the general public by establishing a process to enforce the minimum building standards and property maintenance codes. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-612. - Definitions. 
    The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this article, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: 
    Building official . The officer or other designated authority of the city charged with the administration and enforcement of this article. 
    Landlord . A land or building owner who has leased, rented, or permitted the exclusive use of the land, the building or a part of the land or building, to another person. 
    Lease . A special kind of contract between a property owner and a person wanting temporary enjoyment and exclusive use of the property, in exchange for rent paid to the property owner. 
    Multi-family rental dwelling . A residential building containing three or more attached rental units available for rent. Under this definition an apartment complex can consist of multiple buildings containing three or more rental units. 
    Owner . Any person, agent, firm or corporation having a legal or equitable interest in the property. 
    Rent . Money or other consideration paid by a tenant to a landlord in exchange for the exclusive use and enjoyment of land, a building or a part of a building. 
    Rental unit . Property owned and/or operated by a landlord by whom a tenant has been granted temporary and exclusive use through a verbal or written agreement. 
    Single-family rental dwelling . Any single-family dwelling or individual unit of a two-family dwelling which is rented, leased, or otherwise occupied by a person other than the owner. 
    Tenant . A person to whom a landlord grants temporary and exclusive use of land or a part of a building, usually in exchange for rent. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-613. - Prohibited. 
    It shall be prohibited to divide a single-family structure located in a single-family zoning district, including SF-1, SF-2, SF-3, SF-4, and ZLL into separate rental units with restricted access to the common areas. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-614. - Permit required. 
    No person shall lease a single-family rental dwelling or multi-family rental dwelling without first obtaining a permit issued under the provisions of this section. It shall be unlawful to submit a false or fraudulent application for a permit. A person who offers for lease a single-family rental dwelling or multi-family rental dwelling knowing that a permit has not been issued or who knows that the permit issued has been revoked commits an offense each day occupied by a tenant. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-615. - Application, form and fees. 
    An applicant for a single-family rental unit permit shall file with the city a written application, on the form provided for that purpose, signed by the owner (or the owner's authorized agent) of the rental unit to be permitted. An applicant who owns more than one single-family residential dwelling shall file a separate application for each dwelling. Owners (or the owner's authorized agent) of multi-family rental dwelling units may file a single application that includes each rental unit with a common address. 
(1)  Form, contents . The application shall include: 
a.  The name, physical street address, telephone number, e-mail address, and driver's license or other government-issued identification number of the owner, and the name, street address, e-mail address and telephone number of any property manager of the property for which an application is being submitted; 
b.  If the owner is other than an individual, the legal name, all trade names, and the registered agent, managing partner, or other person authorized to accept service of process on behalf of the owner; and 
c.  The name and telephone number of the tenant responsible for a single-family rental dwelling unit, if available, at the time of application. 
(2)  Annual Fee . Applications for the permit shall include an annual permit fee of $75.00 per single-family rental dwelling unit and $75.00 per each multi-family rental dwelling unit. 
(3)  Agent for service . An owner may designate on the application an agent for service of process who shall be the authorized agent for purposes of notice and other communications provided in this section. If an owner designates an agent for service as provided in this subsection, service of any notice under this Code on the designated agent shall constitute service upon the owner unless the building official receives actual written notice from the owner that the designated agent is no longer authorized to accept service on behalf of the owner. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-616. - Smoke detector/carbon monoxide detector. 
    The applicant shall certify that the rental unit for which the application is submitted is equipped with properly working smoke detectors and carbon monoxide detectors in accordance with the provisions of the current adopted editions of the International Property Maintenance Code and the International Building Code. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-617. - Permit copy. 
    A permit issued pursuant to this section shall be maintained by the city, with a copy provided to the permittee. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-618. - Permit non-assignable; surrender. 
    A permit issued under this section is not assignable or transferable. A permit is valid only for the premises for which it is issued. It shall be unlawful for any person to counterfeit, forge, change, deface, or alter a permit. A permit may be canceled upon written request of the owner(s) and surrender of the permit itself to the building official. The surrender of a permit shall be effective immediately upon its filing in the office of the building official. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-619. - Inspections. 
    The premises for which the application is submitted or for which a permit has been previously issued shall be inspected for compliance with the provisions of the current adopted editions of the International Property Maintenance Code and the International Building Code, as follows: 
(1)  Single-family rental dwelling units shall be fully inspected each time a change in tenancy occurs in the rental unit, unless the unit is certified under the guidelines listed in section 10-627, herein. Nothing contained in this section shall be construed to prohibit an inspection at the request of a tenant. 
(2)  Multi-family rental dwelling units shall be inspected one time per calendar year with no inspection required at change of tenancy. Permit applications and fees will be due no later than the last day of January of each year. The city will conduct the inspections throughout the year. Each complex will receive one months' notice before the inspection will commence. It shall be the multi-family rental dwelling complex's responsibility to notify the tenant of the impending inspection if occupied. Nothing contained in this section shall be construed to prohibit an inspection at the request of a tenant. 
(3)  The city may re-inspect any rental unit as necessary to determine compliance. No permit shall be issued if, after inspection, it is determined that the premises do not comply with the minimum housing standards contained in the International Property Maintenance Code and the International Building Code. 
(4)  The building official or their designee shall enforce the provisions of this article upon presentation of proper identification to the owner of any rental unit or, if occupied, to the tenant residing in any rental unit and, with the owner and/or tenant's permission, may inspect the unit. The authority to conduct both exterior and interior inspections by the building official is subject to all limitations provided in state and federal law. If entry is refused by the owner or tenant or could not be obtained, the building official is authorized to seek a warrant pursuant to Article 18.05 of the Texas Code of Criminal Procedure as the same may be amended from time to time. Any warrants issued will constitute authority for the building official to enter upon and inspect the rental unit described therein. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-620. - Release of utilities. 
    A release of utilities for single-family rental dwelling units, and when applicable to multi-family rental dwelling units, may be provided upon application for utilities pending a change in tenancy inspection. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-621. - Period of validity. 
    Each permit issued under this section shall be valid for one year from its date of issuance, unless suspended or revoked. Single-family rental dwellings certified under section 10-627 herein are valid for a period of three years unless suspended or revoked. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-622. - Temporary tenancies. 
    It shall be an affirmative defense to prosecution that the single-family residential dwelling was rented or leased for a period of less than 60 days to a person who was the immediate past owner of the dwelling or who shall be the immediate next owner of the dwelling. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-623. - Suspension of permit. 
    The city may temporarily suspend a permit for a single-family rental dwelling and multi-family rental dwelling, if: 
(1)  After notice and a period of time allowed for correction a critical violation remains on the premises of the rental unit; or 
(2)  After a single-family or multi-family rental dwelling unit is subject to change in tenancy inspection and the city has not received a request for inspection within 60 days of application for utilities. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-624. - Reinstatement of suspended permit. 
    A person whose permit has been suspended may, at any time, make written application for a re-inspection for the purpose of reinstating the permit. Within ten days following receipt of a request, which shall include a statement signed by the applicant that in the applicant's opinion, all of the violations that caused suspension of the permit have been corrected, the city shall make a re-inspection. Upon re-inspection, if all life safety, critical, and noncritical violations have been corrected, the permit shall be reinstated. If all violations have not been corrected the permit will continue to be suspended. the city shall charge a fee of $50.00 for the second re-inspection. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-625. - Revocation of permit. 
    For serious or repeated violations of any of the requirements of this article, or for interference with the city or any of its agents in the performance of their duties, the permit may be permanently revoked after the city has provided an opportunity for a hearing. Prior to such action, the city shall notify the holder of the permit in writing, stating the reasons for which the permit is subject to revocation and advising that the permit shall be permanently revoked at the end of ten days from the service of such notice unless a request for a hearing is filed with the city, by the permit holder, within such ten-day period. A permit shall be suspended for cause pending its revocation or a hearing relative thereto. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-626. - Hearings. 
    The hearings provided for in this section shall be conducted, by the city's zoning board of adjustment (ZBA). The ZBA shall make a finding and shall sustain, modify, or rescind any official notice or order considered in the hearing. A written report of the hearing decision shall be furnished to the permit holder by the city. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Sec. 10-627. - Certification training course and certified rental properties. 
(a)  Notwithstanding the provisions of sections 10-619 and 10-620 of this section, a permit for a single-family rental dwelling unit shall be issued for a period of three years, and the rental unit shall not be subject to re-inspection or re-certification even in the event of a change in tenancy during that three-year term, if: 
(1)  The owner (or the property manager) of the single-family rental dwelling unit has completed a certification training course provided by the building official at no charge; and 
(2)  The permit for the single-family rental dwelling unit has not been suspended or revoked during the three-year term of the extended permit authorized by this subsection. 
(b)  During the three-year term, after an initial inspection, a certified single-family rental dwelling unit shall submit an annual registration application and submit an annual fee of $50.00. A certified single-family rental dwelling unit shall be subject to an inspection every three years if no enforcement action has been commenced during the previous permit period against the permit holder or the permitted property for a violation of a provision of this chapter that has resulted in one or more of the following: 
(1)  A conviction for a violation; 
(2)  The issuance of an abatement action work order by the city to correct the violation; or 
(3)  An action regarding the violation has been presented to the ZBA. 
(c)  Upon expiration of the permit period, if an enforcement action as described in subsection (b)(2) has been taken against a certified property or the owner of a certified property, the property shall revert to an annual permit unless, upon inspection of the property and verification of compliance with this chapter, the building official determines that the public interest will be served by re-permitting the property as a certified property for a three year permit interval. 
(d)  Upon expiration of the permit period, if no enforcement as described in subsection (b)(2) has been taken, the owner or owner's agent may keep the property in certified status at the time of permit renewal and inspection with no additional training required. The owner or owner's agent will be required to provide access to the unit with notice of the pending inspection provided to the tenant. 
(e)  Multi-family rental dwelling owners or agents may attend the certification training course provided by the building official at no charge to receive a $25.00 fee reduction per unit upon successful completion. The certification training course will be offered two times per year: once in January and once in December. 
(Ord. No. 2018-17, § 1, 9-18-18) 
Chapter 14 - BUSINESSES[1] 
Footnotes:

ARTICLE I. - IN GENERAL 

Secs. 14-1-14-30. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE II. - PERMITS[2] 

Footnotes: 
--- (2) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 2011-11, § 1, adopted June 21, 2011, amended article II in its entirety to read as herein set out. Formerly, article II pertained to similar subject matter and derived from the Code of 1987, §§ 12-1-12-5. 

Sec. 14-31. - Required. 
    It shall be unlawful to operate any business, whether retail, wholesale, manufacturing, industrial or otherwise, from or upon any premises located within the city, without first obtaining a permit therefor from the city. 
(Ord. No. 2011-11, § 1, 6-21-11) 
Sec. 14-32. - Purpose; fee; renewal. 
    The purpose of this article is only to enable the city and its officials to know of the existence, location, ownership and nature of each business operated from and upon premises within the corporate limits of the city and to be more able to ascertain whether the operation thereof is in compliance with other ordinances of the city or applicable state laws. The application fee for a permit under this article shall be $20.00 per year to defray the expense of maintaining a correct list of such businesses. Each permit issued hereunder shall be for the calendar year in which issued, and the fee will not be devisable for less than a full calendar year. The permit shall be renewable annually on or before February 1 for the calendar year. Any business commencing during a calendar year shall pay the same fee for a permit for the remaining portion of the year following its commencement. 
(Ord. No. 2011-11, § 1, 6-21-11) 
Sec. 14-33. - Application. 
    Application for a permit under this article shall be in writing and shall contain the following information: 
(1)  The address within the city upon or from which the business is operated; 
(2)  The legal description of the premises on which it is located; 
(3)  The names and addresses of the owners thereof; 
(4)  The names and addresses of the persons in a managerial position operating the business, if different from the owners; 
(5)  The name or names under which the business will be operated; 
(6)  The date of commencement of the business and its expected duration; 
(7)  A full and complete description of the nature of the business that is, whether retail or wholesale, manufacturing, service or otherwise including information as to the nature of the products manufactured, sold, stored and/or distributed by or through the business; and 
(8)  The applicant's state sales tax number. 
(Ord. No. 2011-11, § 1, 6-21-11) 
Sec. 14-34. - Exempt businesses; waiver of fee under certain circumstances. 
(a)  The following businesses are expressly exempt from the provisions of this article: 
(1)  Any business that involves only distribution within the city, such as distribution by street delivery, through the mail or otherwise, without the location of a business office or headquarters, warehouse, store, shop, etc., upon identifiable premises within the city. 
(2)  Any business for which a permit or license is required under state or federal law, but only if the licensing or permit legislation of the state and/or federal government is of such a nature as to constitute a preempting of the field to the extent that a registration permit requirement by the city would be deemed unlawful interference with state or federal regulations of the particular business. 
(3)  Any nondepository financial institution, as defined in article VII of chapter 14 of the City Code, that is registered with the city pursuant to said article. 
(b)  To the extent that a registration permit fee requirement by the city would be deemed preempted pursuant to state or federal regulation of a particular business, the fee is hereby waived and the registration requirement pursuant to this article shall apply without cost to the particular business. 
(Ord. No. 2011-11, § 1, 6-21-11) 
Sec. 14-35. - Significance of issuance. 
    Applications under this article shall be made to the building official of the city, and it shall be the duty of the building official to issue a permit to any business upon the submission of a proper application therefor and payment of the required fee, without any duty to pass upon the legality of the business or its operation. The issuance of a permit shall be evidence only that the business has registered with the city, for identification and disclosure of its existence and operation. Issuance of such permit shall not be construed to constitute municipal approval of the business, and shall not be deemed to authorize the conduct of the business in violation of any federal, state or municipal law or regulation or to stop the city from complaining of the violation by the business of any other valid ordinance or regulation, either federal, state or municipal. 
(Ord. No. 2011-11, § 1, 6-21-11) 
Secs. 14-36-14-60. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE III. - CARE FACILITIES[3] 
Footnotes: 
--- (3) --- 
State Law reference- Administration of federal and state day care programs, V.T.C.A., Human Resource Code ch. 44; convalescent and nursing homes and related institutions, V.T.C.A., Health and Safety Code ch. 242. 

DIVISION 1. - GENERALLY 

Sec. 14-61. - Definitions. 
    The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this article, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: 
    Care home means and includes any residence, building or structure used for the housing as a place of residence, either temporary or permanent, for more than three persons, regardless of age, who are not members of the family of the person or persons owning or operating such place of residence, and are not related to the owner or operator of such place of residence, either by blood, marriage or legal adoption. Care home shall include boarding homes, nursing homes, convalescent homes, rest homes, foster homes, children's homes or any other buildings, structures or group of buildings used for purposes of residence, either temporary or permanent, for more than three persons as set forth in this paragraph, so long as compensation is received from any source for the care of the nonrelated persons referred to in this paragraph, regardless of whether a profit is made or expected therefrom. Care home as used in this article, however, shall not include hospitals, medical clinics, nursery schools or other day care facilities where nonrelated persons are kept during daylight hours only, or private residences wherein persons are kept only as a strictly charitable gesture, without compensation of any kind therefor from an outside source. 
    Person means and embraces any person, firm, association, partnership or corporation, its servants, agents and employees. 
(Code 1987, § 12-21) 
Cross reference- Definitions generally, § 1-2. 
Sec. 14-62. - Compliance with state laws, ordinances and other regulations. 
    In operating or maintaining any care home within the city, the person operating it shall comply with all applicable laws of the state, ordinances of the city, regulations of the state or county health and welfare departments and any pertinent regulations of the fire department. 
(Code 1987, § 12-27) 
Sec. 14-63. - Other minimum requirements. 
    Without intending to limit the applicability of any more stringent provisions of any state law, state or county health or welfare regulations, or provisions of other ordinances of the city, every care home in its construction and operation shall meet the following additional minimum requirements: 
(1)  Separate beds shall be provided for every occupant, except that married persons may occupy a double bed, and not more than two brothers or two sisters (that is, siblings of the same sex related by blood or legal adoption) may occupy a double bed. 
(2)  Every care home shall be provided with at least two outside exits from each story of the building. 
(3)  Buildings of wood frame construction may be used as care homes if not more than two stories in height and built in conformity with building regulations of the city and fire regulations of the city. 
(4)  Bedfast or detention occupants shall be kept on the ground floor of any care home. 
(5)  No care home shall house more than six children who are not related to the owner or operator thereof by blood, marriage or adoption, if the care home is located in any single-family residential district under the zoning ordinance and classification of the city. 
(6)  Every care home shall provide a minimum of 500 cubic feet of living space per occupant in the care home. 
(7)  Every care home shall provide adequate lighting and ventilation and heating for the safeguard of the health of the occupants. 
(8)  Every care home for minor children shall provide constant supervision by an adult person in attendance at all times that the children are housed in the care home. 
(9)  Every care home shall be subject to inspection by city authorities at all reasonable times. 
(Code 1987, § 12-28) 
Secs. 14-64-14-80. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 2. - PERMIT 

Sec. 14-81. - Permit required. 
    No person shall operate or cause to be operated a care home as defined in this article within the city without first obtaining and holding a permit for such operation from the city secretary. 
(Code 1987, § 12-22) 
Sec. 14-82. - Application for permit. 
    Application for a permit to operate a care home within the city shall be made in writing to the city secretary, and shall set forth the name and address of the applicant and of the person to be in charge and supervision of the home, the trade name under which the home will be operated, the address or other property description locating the care home, the number of occupants, the number of beds, floor space, number of personnel and any other relevant information to show the manner in which such care home will be operated. If the applicant is a corporation or association, the application shall disclose the stockholders or owners thereof. Satisfactory evidence shall be included to show the good moral character of the person in charge and the personnel of such care home. 
(Code 1987, § 12-23) 
Sec. 14-83. - Investigation of application and approval of other agencies. 
    The city secretary shall have authority to defer action on an application for a period of not to exceed 30 days after its filing, and to conduct such investigation concerning the application as he deems necessary, referring the application to the city council for approval, rejection or discussion in the event that he deems same needed. The applicant shall furnish with such application, or during the investigation period before same is acted upon, satisfactory proof of approval of said care home by the health officer, building official or his designee, fire marshal and planning and zoning commission of the city, and by the proper regulatory offices of the state health and welfare departments, as well as satisfactory proof of compliance with all of the sanitary, health and building ordinances of the city and regulations of the county, and laws of the state. Upon satisfactory proof of the foregoing, and investigation convincing him of the good moral character of the operator of the care home and compliance with all such regulations and approval of all bodies, the city secretary shall have authority to issue a permit, conditioned on payment of the mentioned fee in section 14-84. 
(Code 1987, § 12-24) 
Sec. 14-84. - Permit fee, duration and transfer. 
    The fee for the permit required by this article shall be the sum of $25.00 per year, to partially defray the cost of investigation and inspection by the city. The fee shall be payable annually in January of each year, or upon filing of an application for permit. The permit shall be renewed in January of each year. Permits issued after January shall be for the remainder of the calendar year. The fee shall be prorated on the basis of $6.50 per quarter of the year or any part of a quarter, not to exceed $25.00 for the year. Permits shall not be transferable, and in the event of transfer of the care home, a new application shall be required for its continued operation. 
(Code 1987, § 12-25) 
Sec. 14-85. - Appeal to council on refusal of permit. 
    If the city secretary shall refuse to issue a permit to any applicant under this article, such applicant shall have the right to appeal to the city council on such refusal by giving written notice filed with the city secretary within ten days after the refusal. The city council, within 30 days and with five days' prior notice to the applicant, shall conduct a public hearing on the appeal, wherein the applicant shall have a full opportunity to present his case, either in person or by counsel. The decision of the city council on such appeal shall be final. 
(Code 1987, § 12-26) 
Sec. 14-86. - Revocation of permit. 
    The city council shall have authority to revoke and cancel any permit issued hereunder for violation of any of the provisions of this article, or any applicable provisions and regulations of the state or county relating to care homes, or any failure of the care home to continue to comply with other applicable ordinances of the city with respect to building standards, safety, fire prevention, etc. Before revocation, however, a public hearing shall be afforded to the person in whose name any permit is issued, with ten days' prior written notice to the holder of the permit specifying the date and place of hearing and the charges upon which revocation is sought. Any official of the city can call to the attention of the city council the need for such hearing and possible revocation of permit issued hereunder. 
(Code 1987, § 12-29) 
Secs. 14-87-14-110. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE IV. - MASSAGE PARLORS[4] 
Footnotes: 
--- (4) --- 
State Law reference- Massage therapists and massage establishments, Vernon's Ann. Civ. St. art. 4512k. 

DIVISION 1. - GENERALLY 

Sec. 14-111. - Definitions. 
    For the purpose of this article, the following words and phrases shall have the meanings, respectively, ascribed to them by this section: 
    Massage means and includes any process consisting in kneading, rubbing or otherwise manipulating the skin or any part of the body of a human being, either with the hands or by means of electrical instruments or apparatus, or other special apparatus, but shall not include massage by duly licensed physicians, registered physical therapists, or massage of the face, head or shoulders by duly licensed beauty parlors or barbershops. 
    Massage establishment means any building, room, place or establishment, other than regularly licensed hospitals, where manipulated massage or manipulated exercises are practice upon the human body by anyone who is not a duly licensed physician, whether with or without use of mechanical, therapeutic or bathing devices, and shall include Turkish bathhouses; provided, however, this phrase shall not include beauty parlors and barbershops duly licensed under the laws of the state, or offices, clinics and establishments of duly licensed physicians, whether doctors of medicine, osteopathy, chiropractors, or of registered physical therapists who treat only patients referred by physician's direction, or the place of work or employment of an athletic trainer who treats only athletes engaged in sports under the supervision or sponsorship of the institution, agency, or corporation or person by whom such trainer is employed. 
    State registered massage therapist means a person who has passed the requirements required by the state and is so registered within the state to perform massage. 
(Ord. No. 95-2, § 1, 4-18-95) 
Cross reference- Definitions generally, § 1-2. 
Sec. 14-112. - Operation of massage establishments. 
    Massage establishments licensed under this article shall be conducted and operated so as to comply with all federal, state, county and city regulations and ordinances. In addition, such establishments shall also be conducted in conformity with the following rules and regulations: 
(1)  No such establishment shall be kept open between the hours of 9:00 p.m. and 8:00 a.m. of the following day. 
(2)  No such establishment, nor any part of the building in which it is operated, shall be used as a place of residence. 
(3)  No such establishment shall ever be located in any area zoned for residential purposes, whether single-family or multifamily. 
(4)  The building official, chief of police, city health officer and fire marshal shall have the right to inspect the premises where such establishment is operated at any and all reasonable times, and without prior notice of their inspections. 
(5)  It shall be unlawful for any person to administer a massage in a massage establishment to a person of the opposite sex, unless the person is a state registered massage therapist or physician as indicated in this article. 
(6)  It shall be the duty of every person operating a massage establishment to keep the same in a clean and sanitary condition at all times. 
(7)  All instruments and mechanical, therapeutic and bathing devices, and parts thereof, which come into contact with the human body, shall be sterilized by a modern and approved method of sterilization before initial use, and after being used by or upon one person, before being used by or upon another person. 
(8)  All masseurs and operators shall wash their hands thoroughly before administering massage manipulation to each person. 
(9)  All towels and linens furnished for use by a patron shall be thoroughly laundered and sanitized before being furnished for use by another patron. 
(10)  It shall be unlawful to employ any person in a massage establishment in any capacity who is a known prostitute. 
(11)  Every person giving massages in such establishment shall remain fully clothed with opaque or nontransparent material, from the neck to the knees, except for the hands or the arms, at all times while serving or in the presence of patrons. 
(12)  No massage establishment shall advertise any manner that would state or imply that a customer would receive anything at such establishment other than a massage, or a massage with private self-administered bath in connection therewith. 
(13)  It shall be unlawful for any person suffering from a communicable or infectious disease to work in a massage establishment, or to employ any such person to work therein. 
(14)  It shall be unlawful to accommodate as a patron in a massage establishment any person suffering from an infectious or communicable disease, if such fact is known to the operator, owner, employee or person in control of such establishment. 
(15)  It shall be the duty of every person operating a massage parlor to submit a list of all current employees of such establishment, together with their addresses and criminal records, if known, current health certificates and registrations or licenses therefor, to the building official every three months while same is in operation on January 1, April 1, July 1, and October 1 of each year. 
(Ord. No. 95-2, § 7, 4-18-95) 
Sec. 14-113. - Penalty. 
    Any person, firm or corporation who violates, disobeys, neglects or refuses to comply with any provision of this article shall be guilty of a misdemeanor, and upon conviction shall be punished by a fine not to exceed $2,000.00. Each day that any violation hereof continues shall be deemed to constitute a distinct and separate offense. 
(Ord. No. 95-2, § 9, 4-18-95) 
Secs. 14-114-14-130. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 2. - LICENSE 

Sec. 14-131. - Required. 
    It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to operate a massage establishment in the city without first having obtained a license therefor from the building official, in accordance with the provisions of this article, and after paying the fee herein provided. Such license shall only be issued upon the approval in writing of the city heath officer, the chief of police, hereinafter referred to as chief, and the zoning officer, after the investigations herein prescribed. The license shall be exhibited at all times in such establishment in a conspicuous location to the public. Massage therapists, as defined in Vernon's Ann. Civ. St. art. 4512k, are exempt from licensing under this section. 
(Ord. No. 95-2, § 2, 4-18-95) 
Sec. 14-132. - License fee. 
    The fee for the investigation and issuance or refusal of a license shall be $100.00, and in case of an original application, shall if approved entitle the applicant to operate such establishment only during the calendar year or any part of a calendar year for which application is made. Any license shall be renewed on January 1 of each calendar year, and is approved, and the fee for renewal shall be the same as the original fee. Such license fees are to help defray the cost of investigation, and no part of any fee shall ever be refunded, regardless of whether the license is granted, denied or revoked. 
(Ord. No. 95-2, § 3, 4-18-95) 
Sec. 14-133. - Application. 
    An application for a license to operate, or renew the operation of, a massage establishment in the city shall be made in writing, on such form as may be prescribed by the building official or city council, and shall be signed by the applicant's full correct name, and shall disclose any nicknames, aliases or other names by which the applicant is then or has ever been known. It shall also disclose the correct address of the residence of the applicant, and the location where the massage establishment is to be operated. The preceding information will also be required of all other persons having any interest in the proposed business, if a corporation, directors, and officers and employees of any proposed or existing massage establishment. It shall state under oath whether any of the owners, officers or employees, or the applicant, have ever been convicted in any court of a felony offense under the criminal laws of the United States, or any state or city, other than traffic offenses of a minor nature. The application shall be accompanied by medical certificates for all present and/or proposed employees of the establishment, by a licensed physician certifying that such employee has been examined and found free of any infectious or communicable disease. The application shall be accompanied by proof of liability insurance by the establishment to cover the premises and employees for injury and bodily harm to its patrons and clients in the amount of at least $300,000.00 per occurrence. The application shall be filed with the building official, who shall forthwith refer it to the chief, the city health officer and the zoning officer, for investigation as required in this article. 
(Ord. No. 95-2, § 4, 4-18-95) 
Sec. 14-134. - Investigation. 
(a)  After application has been made for operation of a massage establishment in the city, whether original or renewal, the following investigations and approvals shall be required, and no license shall be issued or renewed without such investigations and approvals: 
(1)  The chief shall cause investigation to be made as to the character of the applicant, its owner, officers and employees and shall determine whether or not they have been convicted of any offense mentioned in section 14-133, or whether they are persons of unfit character. In case of a renewal application, he shall also determine whether any of them have been guilty of any lewd, indecent or other act contrary to common decency in the operation of the establishment during the preceding license period. If he determines that such convictions or unfit character exist, or such indecency has occurred, he shall note his disapproval thereof. The chief may, in his discretion, approve the application if he shall determine that any conviction is remote and reformation has occurred, or in relation to a convicted employee, that the conviction was unknown to the employer and such employee was or is discharged promptly on the employer's acquisition of knowledge; provided, however, no approval shall be given or license issued if the establishment or the applicant or any of the owners are found to have been previously convicted of a felony for the proposed massage establishment, or any other such establishment previously operated by the applicant. 
(2)  The city health officer shall cause investigation to be made as to whether the proposed employees of the establishment, and existing employees as to a renewal application, are free from infectious and communicable diseases. He shall disapprove the application if diseases are found to exist, unless any such employees are disassociated from the establishment until free from such condition. The city health officer shall also investigate the proposed location or existing location and premises where the establishment is being proposed to be operated, and the existing or proposed methods of operation, to determine if any unhealthy or unsanitary conditions or operations exist. If same are found, he shall disapprove the application, unless or until same are corrected to his satisfaction so as not to be a menace to public health. Otherwise, he shall approve the application as meeting minimum health standards. 
(3)  The zoning officer shall make an investigation to determine whether the proposed location of the massage establishment is in an area where such business is permissible under the zoning ordinance of the city, and whether the building for its operation is in compliance with all applicable building, fire and safety standards of the state, county and city. He may enlist the aid of any other department of the city in making such determinations, and shall approve said application only if all such standards are found to be met and satisfied; otherwise, he shall disapprove same. 
(b)  No license for a massage establishment shall be issued without the approval of all officials designated in this section, whether the application be for an original or renewal license. Such approvals shall be in writing. 
(Ord. No. 95-2, § 5, 4-18-95) 
Sec. 14-135. - Revocation. 
    Any license issued pursuant to this article shall be subject to revocation by the chief if he shall determine that it is being operated in violation of this article, or other ordinances of the city, or of any statute of the state or the United States, or that the license holder or his/her employees are of unfit character to conduct the business, or the purposes for which such license has been issued are being abused to the detriment of the public, or that the license is being used for purposes different from those for which it was issued to the license holder. Notice of suspension or revocation shall be given by the chief by mailing same to the license holder's last known address, or by delivering written notice to the holder in person, or if he/she cannot be found, by delivering written notice to the location of such business. If the license holder shall make request therefor in writing to the chief within three days after the delivery or mailing of such notice, the suspension or revocation shall be deferred until he/she has been afforded a public hearing before the chief on the reasons for such revocation or suspension, and then shall be imposed only if the chief finds after such hearing that revocation or suspension is justified. 
(Ord. No. 95-2, § 6, 4-18-95) 
Sec. 14-136. - Right of appeal.
